intro: Ceratostema madisonii, commonly known as Madison's bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
